title: Drawing, "Mantelpiece Detail, Music Room", ca. 1820
medium: Watercolor, graphite on white wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. The vertical elements of the design are semicircular in section composed of a series of colonnettes with simple capitals and bases. The entablature of the mantel is composed of a dragon with outstretched wings, in bold relief. Andirons and fire-screen, in the Chinese style, included in design.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Mantelpiece Detail, Music Room", ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Watercolor, graphite on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-73.
